metadata.title: CVE-2023-20569 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - high
metadata.description:
A side channel vulnerability on some of the AMD CPUs may allow an attackerto influence the return address prediction. This may result in speculativeexecution at an attacker-controlled address, potentially leading toinformation disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-20569` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

amd64-microcode - 3.20230808.1.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: amd64-microcode package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20230808.1.1ubuntu1').
linux package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-9.9').
linux-aws package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1008.8').
linux-azure package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1007.7').
linux-gcp package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1007.7').
linux-gke package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1009.9').
linux-lowlatency package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-9.9.1').
linux-oracle package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1010.10').
linux-raspi package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1005.7').
